properties.name: Batu Ferringhi
properties.description: Posted by Farithrezza Batu Ferringhi, situated along the coastal road north-west of Georgetown and lined with a string of international-standard resorts, is the most popular beach in Penang. Soak in the sun or unwind on the beach while you enjoy a host of aquatic thrills from wind-surfing to canoeing. For a spine-tingling adventure, try parasailing to enjoy the view of the beach from the sky. As the sun sets, Batu Ferringhi comes alive with a carnival-like atmosphere with an open-air bazaar selling anything from ornate curios to enticing souvenir items. Watch local artisans demonstrate the intricate art of craft-making and batik-painting. Dubbed the Feringghi Walk, the bazaar offers shoppers a host of attractions. Copyright © 2007 Tourism Malaysia.

properties.name: Bihun Hangit
properties.description: Posted by Farithrezza A local traditional restaurant serving special breakfast dishes, the unique bihun hangit. Located by the river across Kg. Pertama mosque.

properties.name: Bukit Bendera
properties.description: Posted by Farithrezza Jalan Bukit BenderaPopular among local and tourists, located 830 meters above sea level. 30 minutes by the funicular train to the top, which offers magnificent panoramic view of mainland.

properties.name: Butterfly Farm
properties.description: Posted by Farithrezza World\'s first tropical butterfly farm founded in 1986.

properties.name: Craven Cafe
properties.description: Posted by Farithrezza  A very fine spot to observe local and tourist passing-by while taking your breakfast or lunch.

properties.name: Dajie Cafe
properties.description: Posted by Farithrezza A vegetarian cafe famous for its desserts. Located at China Street, Georgetown, it has beautiful oriental interior and great desserts such as cendol, longan, etc

properties.name: Fort Cornwallis
properties.description: Posted by Farithrezza Located on the northeastern coast of Penang, it is the largest standing fort in Malaysia. Built by Captain Francis Light in 1786 and named after Charles Cornwallis, the 18th century governor-general of Bengal, India.

properties.name: Kek Lok Si Temple
properties.description: Posted by Farithrezza The largest Buddhist temple in Southeast Asia

properties.name: Penang Bridge
properties.description: Posted by Farithrezza Penang bridge connects the island (Gelugor) and the mainland (Seberang Prai). Open to public in 1985, it is a two-way toll bridge and is the longest bridge in Malaysia.

properties.name: Penang Ferry
properties.description: Posted by Farithrezza Began operation in 1920, it is the oldest ferry service in Malaysia. It connects both ferry terminal at Butterworth (mainland) and Weld Quay, Georgetown (island).

properties.name: Snake Temple
properties.description: Posted by Farithrezza Dedicated to Chor Soo Kong, the temple is a sanctuary for pit vipers, built in 1850.
